page.title: 12ST.MARY'S LANDS, WARWICK.
page.content: Used to be common land with certain houses having grazing rights.Lamas Fields part of it with some houses having grazing rights from 1st August to Candlemas.Informal horse racing was started in l809 and golf in the 1890's No charge could be made because of rights.In 1948 common rights extinguished by Warwick corporation Act.Public could then be excluded on race days and a charge made.Course leased out for 2l years in 1967.Land for golf course and driving range leased out in 1969.This was not too popular as it restricted use of land by public e.g.Scouts having tracking games.About 37 acres let to farmer for hay or silage and some let for rugby and football pitches.An area away from houses is used for model aeroplane flying.Other events:steam fair,caravan rally,camping,half marathon,circus.
